intro: Schizodium antenniferum, commonly known as the red-flowered schizodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to deep red. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture. Schizodium antenniferum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
